website_summaries.verdict: Excellent set of in-ear headphones with secure loop feature and improved drive unit technology for better sound.
pros: Redesigned C5 Series with new drive units for better sound and new, more comfortable cable
iPhone remote and microphone compatible cable, for control of iPhone or smartphone and switching between music and making calls
More secure with padded loop that curls around the ear’s inner rim to hold them in place
Richer sound with Micro Porous Filter, which acts as a sonic diffuser
cons: Biggest complaint appears to be issues with fit and lack of comfort, even with the added loop feature (and sometimes because of it!

website_summaries.verdict: The Bowers & Wilkins C5 Series 2 earphone pair has upgraded drivers and a fantastic sound signature with deep bass response and clear highs, just like its predecessor.
pros: Powerful audio performance with rich lows, detailed highs, and excellent balance
cons: More bass and less crispness in high-mids than some listeners seeking flat response might prefer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but might break within a year
customer_reviews.text: Sound is amazing for this size, but only after you install the right size ear tips. After almost a year of use, one earphone stopped playing. Reached out to their support, they gave me an address of their local partner to ship it to, and after some time, they shipped me a new pair for replacement. With just one issue: it had medium size ear tips installed instead of large ones that I sent it with to them. Reached out again - new set of ear tips sent. So minus one star for durability, but still awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i have the P7's and they are fantastic. However
customer_reviews.text: i have the P7's and they are fantastic. However, these C5's are the perfect thing for winter days and the wearing of hats. the sound is superb, the fit/design is excellent. if you're one for enjoying HiFi, then for me these for me really enhance my enjoyment of the music i love.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Superb earphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ear phones - sound superb and have a clever infinitely adjustable ear fitting method that keeps them in your ears. But don't pull them out, twist them out to avoid risk of damage to wires though seem to have a very robust wire attachment, just don't take the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Herts Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Best in ear headphones i have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best in ear headphones i have ever had. And better than the over ear i have had.me my friend and my daughter agree the sound is excellent. My daughter doesn't find them comfortable though but i fall asleep in them and they stay in. Expensive in ear headphones but you can see why. My friends hifiman £320 over ear headphones are no better maybe more comfortable but even he agrees these are cracking set of headphones .
customer_reviews.author: smudge

customer_reviews.title: A layman's opinion
customer_reviews.text: Purchased P7 initially for the phone, despite all the complimentary reviews on the internet, didn't feel like it's suitable for a phone, as the sound quality was harsh (even with lossless songs), it might works well with an amplifier. So got a C5 instead, works a lot better, like the sound..
customer_reviews.author: BoseMINI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound & Build
customer_reviews.text: Sound and build quality is excellent, it takes sometime to get the hang of getting the loop correctly in the ear, before that it can be an irritant for long usage .. However, I think it not difficult to find what works for you the best , try a few adjustment on size of curvature and then the correct turn to have them plugged right. Bowers & Wilkins should have put a few diagrams on how to insert them correctly and saved many folks the pain
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I had to get used to the design what fit is concerned (that works well for me now) but that was a small thing considering that these headphones sounds fantastic. Detail is superb. This is the first set where I had to turn the bass down using my own tips.
customer_reviews.author: Aif The Knaif

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for prolonged use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before a long haul flight back in October 2017. At £80 the price was too much of a bargain to ignore and the sound quality is excellent too. Unfortunately I can't wear them for long listening periods despite lots of fiddling with the loop, just too uncomfortable for my lobes.
customer_reviews.author: Nickeliovich

customer_reviews.title: Great little phones
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic comfortable little phones. Had some Bose sound sport but they continued to drop out of my ears when walking. These little babies stay put and deliver a similar sound quality
customer_reviews.author: JAMES K.

customer_reviews.title: nice ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from ear buds, nice headphones, they work well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Boggie

customer_reviews.title: B&W worst audio device
customer_reviews.text: Over bass and very little treble. I’m disappointed with B&W. This product is a drop in their quality
customer_reviews.author: FELIPE  ARIAS CAÑADAS

customer_reviews.title: good earphones, bad amazon page
customer_reviews.text: “They will also work with all other smartphones, tablets and MP3 players (mobile devices other than compatible iOS models will not necessarily offer control functionality)” not working with my android phone. everything else is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: use them as my daily headphones after the default iPhone headphones died. very very pleased with them. very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, aweful buds.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound but the fit is terrible, I got past that by buying memory phone buds.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: cracking ear phones just need to get them to fit right in your ear
customer_reviews.author: mickclayton

customer_reviews.title: It's okay sound wise, but it's just so dang ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay sound wise, but it's just so dang uncomfortable to wear! Those hoops make them feel weird and I don't see how they change in any positive way.

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise a brilliant pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Cord crackling due to disconnections. Otherwise a brilliant pair of headphones. Returning the item to amazon and repurchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy and not comfortable to wear. But the sound is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: YS

customer_reviews.title: Get an 'earful' of these!
customer_reviews.text: Once use to them (fitting) they are out of this world. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: soreleftfoot

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sounds!
customer_reviews.text: Got these today as a birthday present to myself and I'm staggered by how good they are. The sound is full, the bass is deep, you can pick out every note. It's like carrying around the band with you, it's so immediate. They're expensive but my God they're worth every penny. Also when you register them with B&W you get a couple of months free downloads so I'm now listening to lossless Maria Callas, just sublime. If you're in the market for headphones you must buy these, just stunning sound!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Moynagh

customer_reviews.title: Even better the the first version and so far the best ...
customer_reviews.text: Even better the the first version and so far the best in-hear earphone I've ever came across. The new cable is also an improvement from the first version, whose cable was a bit too stiff. This one is quite stiff as well, just not as stiff.
customer_reviews.author: moniker

customer_reviews.title: The sound is sublime but the fit was horrible. I had to return them as wearing them ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is sublime but the fit was horrible. I had to return them as wearing them for only 15 minutes made my ears hurt.
customer_reviews.author: AndyOfEngland

customer_reviews.title: Current favourite for the price
customer_reviews.text: Tested quite a few earphones over the years and these are my current favourite. Stay firmly lodged in my ears (all my previous models seemed to fall out way too easily - I must have big ears) and give a great clear open sound. Strong lo's, accurate hi's. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: MR MARK J CHITTY

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality..... Horrible Fit
customer_reviews.text: As sound quality goes Bowers and Wilkins are superb, i own the P7 already but wanted these for the in ear neatness, unfortunately with the C5 they use a loop to sit inside your ear and kit them snug, this must be fine for some people but not everyone's ear shape must be the same as these kept pushing out of my ears, found them to be very annoying to wear and so i had to return them, so for sound quality it would be 4 stars but for fit its 1 star..
customer_reviews.author: Aidey

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound + Terrible Fit = Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a week and I wish I'd never bought them. The inner loop made them impossible to fit in my ears. I removed the loop from the groove and while it made it easier to get into my ears these are the worst fitting ear buds I have ever used. The sound us great but the fit means wearing them is not a pleasure. There must be better all round earphones at the price. I see others have had the same problem. The design is too clever by half.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: much better base than my Bose IE2's
customer_reviews.text: I just received these and whilst I am impressed with the sound quality, much better base than my Bose IE2's...the volume control doesn't function properly despite the fact they are brand new. This means instead of being able to enjoy them I must now potter about trying to exchange them... If I manage to get this remediated it deserves a 5 star due to the awesome sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Davi

customer_reviews.title: Stays in ears, and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I use them with my iPhone and it all works well. The loop on these work great, keeping them in your ear comfortably and they block out outside noise very well. Even better, these sound great. I'm picky about sound and I use these to listen to music, use them on stage as ear monitors, and make calls with them with my phone. I bought this in early 2017 and had no problems ever, - until I lost them. Just ordered another set. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding in-ear headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These B&W C5-S2's sound awesome! Deep lows, perfect mids, and smooth (not edgy) highs. Many other brands bump up the lows unnaturally and the highs are too brittle and edgy. These have a very musical response much like Polk Audio's tower speakers. I'm very satisfied with how they sound and their build quality. Unfortunately, they don't fit my ear perfectly, but good enough so they won't fall out easily. Human ears come in vastly different shapes, so the only way you're going to get a "perfect" fit is to get your ears molded and custom fitted and that's expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Jason McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, simply unbeatable at this price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to serve as a backup for my various wireless headphones I use at work. Sometimes the battery dies during an important Skype call and I need to have a spare. That said, there is nothing remotely close to these in sound quality for the price. They have decent passive noise canceling for my walk to the office and phone calls have been clear. The sound quality for music is just unbelievable, I am truly impressed. These are now my daily driver at work but I doubt I will take them to the gym, that’s where wires become a problem. All in all, amazing headphone assuming they fit your ear correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete826

customer_reviews.title: More boom for your $$$
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Senheisser, Bose, Harman/Kardon, and B&O which were all pretty decent for the money but these definitely produce a much bigger bottom end without any discernible degradation of your mids and highs at the same time. Once you open the box spend a few minutes trying the different ear cushion sizes and adjust the little retainer loops to fit your ear properly since a good seal is needed for the best sound, as with any other earbuds. My past earbuds would cause my ears to ache after an hour or two of use. I have not noticed any aches or pains from wearing these for a few hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I think these are nice in-ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I think these are nice in-ear buds, however for the price I'm going to be critical. The fit is a little snug for my ears, and they are bass heavy. I've tried these for casual listening, and when running. When running they would pop out of my ears and for casual listening my ears would get sore under the weight and fit of the component if I ad them in for too long. Overall pretty good, but not perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: NovelParts

customer_reviews.title: best sound quality from the varieties I tested
customer_reviews.text: Of the corded ear pieces I tried, these have the best sound, the best fit, and do fulfill the requirements to send the commands to the iPhone 7 to raise/lower volume, start/stop/pause/skip/go back the music - and when on phone calls I can hear and be heard with good sound quality. I do most of my talking while walking the sidewalks of New York, surrounded by honking, sirens and general noise - and these really win the prize for managing to muffle all that and keep the focus on hearing each word of the conversation (or the music if I so choose).
customer_reviews.author: The Julia ListTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphones I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding headphones I’ve ever used. I was skeptical about the inner ear ring and how it works but it hasn’t been an issue. Wire usually stays untangled while in the case so I don’t spend hours to straighten them back out each time I want to use them. High or low volume listening is very detailed. Great low frequency response. No sound overpowers the other in my opinion. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lil caillou

customer_reviews.title: These earphones seem punchier and more fun than my old Etymotic EP4s
customer_reviews.text: These earphones seem punchier and more fun than my old Etymotic EP4s. I enjoy listening with them. The way the earphones fit with those loops is kind of unusual, and at first they seemed uncomfortable, but I learned to adjust them and I even like the way they fit now. A problem is the earphones are longer than the EP4s, so if you try to go to sleep listening, it's uncomfortable if you turn your head sideways on a pillow. Also the loops tend to tangle up the lead wires. The designers should have considered these factors.
customer_reviews.author: S. North

customer_reviews.title: For few people
customer_reviews.text: Mostly unless you have giant ear lobes this isn’t for you. It’s a pain to fit them in and it hurts when they’re in. This bad fit caused them to fall out constantly. The ring is very ineffective and uncomfortable. As for sound quality goes it’s way too bass heavy and without the proper high frequencies to compensate. It heavily drowns the mid range making any rock and edm hurt to listen to. 6/10 some ppl could make use of it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Peregoy

customer_reviews.title: Sound is not good
customer_reviews.text: These are the most uninspiring lifeless pair of buds I’ve ever listened to. The low bass doesn’t exist. The mid & high bass are bumped enough to bleed dar into the mids. It doesn’t help that the mids are set back which makes the ‘bass’ even more dominant. The mid highs are decent but, meh. And the upper highs are terribly rolled off. For this price of $150, invest your $ elsewhere. Unless the sound I describe is what you’re looking for, Try Shure se215. For same price you get a wireless setup.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding earbuds I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding earbuds I have owned. That said, I typically purchase $50-$100 Klipsch, Shure, UE, Sennheiser. These blow them all out of the water. If you own B&W speakers, you can expect similar balance, punch and clarity out of these earbuds. Pros: -Sound is amazing, worth the price if you want high end earbuds. - in line mic / controls are a nice touch. Cons: -I'm not sure exactly how they want me to put these in/on my ears. -I wish the plug was "L" shaped
customer_reviews.author: D. Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Best plug in head phones ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality for people who listen to anything from The Temptations, Tiesto, or Kendrick Lamar. Got some great bass, at first they wont really sound different than other ear buds but once you get the squishy memory foam like ear bud inserts (which almost all brands are compatible with this set) it makes a world of difference. I highly recommend these if you are looking for high end non-Bluetooth set of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Yapp

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice, only covered once with warranty
customer_reviews.text: I think this are good headphones for the price point. They provide adequate sound quality and a good seal. My issue is with B&W's customer service. One headphone died before the two-year warranty was up but then that pair also died in about a year. The warranty is only good from the time of the initial purchase so I was asked to pay $80 for an out of warranty replacement, something I can't justify based on the fact I don't think these have a long shelf life with regular usage. I have yet to find a pair of wired earbuds that can last a long time, so the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Was very disappointed! Respect the Bowers & Wilkins name and their ...
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed! Respect the Bowers & Wilkins name and their speakers are out of this world. So bought these earphones. Very disappointed. They sound gets "muddy" from the high midrange to the top of the frequency range. Never expected this from B&W.
customer_reviews.author: Shaukat Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancelled
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work to cancel noise. These have a perfect fit and the quality of sounds is beautiful. One of the cables broke by the ear piece within a year, but B&W provided excellent customer care and sent me a new pair right away.
customer_reviews.author: Elvijs-Kristians

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound, but fell apart after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed when these fell apart a year after buying them. I have owned an over the ear product of theirs since 2011 and was a fan. These worked well, but within 6 months the gray mesh on the back of each had fallen off and last week the casing fell off the right earbud exposing the wire which frayed and now doesn't work. These pieces are simply glued together and normal stress caused them to come apart. For this price point, I was hoping to have these for a while. My search for quality earbuds that last continues.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kitzis

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound good right out of the box. They have great base and a very balanced sound. The tried many headphones from Sure, Klipsch, Sennheiser, Symphonized NRG 2.0 and Sony. These kick all of them to the curb. I am glad I found them because they perfectly voiced. I have to update my first review, after breaking these headphones and learning how to use them. I am in love. You can't get a better sounding headphone on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Agnar150

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: A while back I purchased Bose Free SoundSport, and the quality of sound that Bose is known for was not missing from those bluetooth headphones. I wanted some "plug in" headphones that weren't bluetooth and these Bowers & Wilkins C5 Series 2 In-Ear Headphones, have a snug fit in my ear, which is saying a lot because I've had many problems with a secure fit. The quality of sound is crisp and clear, and I like the volume control on the cord to elevate or lower the volume without having to find the app or icon. Pleased with my purchase and would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, good fit... fell apart after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The sound and noise cancellation were both great for earbuds. The fit was tight but needed regular adjusting especially when working out. Cons: The mic/remote on the wire fell apart and had to be taped together after a year. One of the earbuds broke and was hanging by a wire after two years. The wire snapped a week or two later. The quality of the build is very poor for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: ... staying in my ears and the loop is a brilliant product design
customer_reviews.text: I have a VERY difficult time with earbuds actually staying in my ears and the loop is a brilliant product design. I can wear these for hours without having to adjust them. As for the sound quality, these are absolutely premium and well deserving of the Bowers & Wilkins name. I've never heard a better sounding earbud. They perform very well throughout the entire frequency range. Tight bass, surprisingly deep for an ear bud, and most importantly, NO distortion. Five stars aren't enough. STRONG recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones - super clean
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones - super clean, very true sound, though its somewhat on the bass-heavy side on some songs. But they beat the pants out of Beats by Dre and other overpriced headphones. Only docking a star because the fit is a bit tough to get right, and could be annoying to a lot of people. Also, because they are noise isolating (not noise cancelling, mind you), they "plug" your ears, creating an effect where you can basically hear yourself breathe, walk, etc. But you get used to it and the quality of the sound more than makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Oskee2001

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: I could never get headphones to stay in my ears. These are definitely the most adjustable headphones i have ever used. Not just the earbud size, but an adjustable wire adjusts to your ear shape around the ear bud. I hear symbols and instrumental sounds I never heard before with other headphones. I would recommend these to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Vito

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but hard to get a good fit
customer_reviews.text: The way the bud secures into the ear is with a wire loop that can be pushed and made bigger. This sort of wedges the bud in place. I find it does not work very effectively. Sound quality is good when you can get the fit just perfect (which is almost never).
customer_reviews.author: The Ops Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, cruddy design
customer_reviews.text: Not designed all that great. Constantly falling out of ears. I've used all sorts of ear pieces and never had a problem. I'm always pushing these in trying to get them to stay in. Other than that, great sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Horace Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Super uncomfortable + constantly fall out of ears. They sounds fabulous, if you can stand them. Wish they had a different mechanism for staying in your ear, maybe a soft wing like the V-MODA Forza? That's what I ended up with but they don't sounds as good as these at all.
customer_reviews.author: James Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after a year (same as others)
customer_reviews.text: At first the fitting was a bit weird but then I got used to it and worked great. Sound quality is really good too. Unfortunately I had the same bad luck as others after a ~year where the silver ear bud part fell out. I'm not rough with them and stow them carefully in my work desk everyday. Sad that they didn't hold up. Just plan on them only lasting year and half.
customer_reviews.author: Shane__

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent head phones: this is my second pair after I lost my first pair. Love the rich sound, love the fit, love that they semi-block outside noise. Recently reached out their customer service department: very adequate follow up. This interaction confirmed that these expensive head phones are worth their money.
customer_reviews.author: Mariane Chair, Westchester, NY

customer_reviews.title: Didn't live up with B&W name
customer_reviews.text: I pulled the trigger after seeing many craving reviews on cnet, whathifi,.. about the detailed mids, wide soundstage, tight bass. I myself also own a setup of B&W floorstanding speakers. This headphone arrived and I have been trying it for a week. The build quality and the design are indeed superb. The sound quality is much better than the stock AKG of my galaxy S9 but inferior to anything else. The bass is muddy, the mid and hight are restrained. It seems B&W is trying to make a headphone that excels in everything and they just overdo it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ng SAT Tutor

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds sound very good, the high end is nice and airy, the base and the bottom end sounds equally as well. I would actually rate this as a 5-star item. However, there is a problem with the fitting, I bought these primarily for the golf course. The problem is that the earbuds comes lose, and you have to re-adjust every third swing. Other than that they are great sounding earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Samp Man

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommend ! No reason to take a star
customer_reviews.text: Best choice over this price. I became a fan of B&W after bought P7, so when I need a small one I select this without any hesitate. Wear comfortable, your ears could be pain after long time wearing my last headphone CKR9, but not with c5 anymore. This time I buy it as a gift with strong satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawless sound, still in-ears
customer_reviews.text: Sound is beyond flawless, as expected from B&W, excellent noise isolation, somewhat finicky to manage, as expected from in-ears. It pains me so to give anything B&W fewer than 5 stars, but... there really needs to be a solution to the wayward nature of in-ears. I feel that they would benefit from a band to hold them together.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are absolutely worth it! These have been the most expensive in-hear headphones I bought so far but the audio definition is stunning. I compared them against my iphone and Kilpsch Image S4-II headphones and wow, there were so many sounds I couldn't even distinguish in those previously mentioned. Pros: Amazing audio Great bass Comfortable Great passive noise canceling Cons: None so far, maybe price.
customer_reviews.author: arturo

customer_reviews.title: Love these In-Earphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these In-Earphones. Fit and sound are great. BUT I filled out a form to repair my previous version C5 four times and have yet to receive a reply. So I guess the inference is when they fail purchase a new when possible! Have heard about customer service at Bowers & Wilkins, I hoped they would have improved!
customer_reviews.author: nrs

customer_reviews.title: The earpiece on these is hard plastic, not silicone
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very nice. But the design is for ears much larger than mine. The part that is supposed to fit into the curve of your ear is hard, inflexible plastic. They are quite painful to wear for more than half an hour. Most earbuds either come with interchangeable pieces or are flexible. The chances of these fitting any give person are small. I would have liked them a lot if I could actually use them . . .
customer_reviews.author: jprameau

customer_reviews.title: These B&W earbuds have great clarity with a tendency towards bass
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is what you would expect from a set of earphones in this price range. These B&W earbuds have great clarity with a tendency towards bass. This generation is not as comfortable as the previous ones I owned. No matter which adapters I put on, I tend to feel fatigue and discomfort after any extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Arkudos

customer_reviews.title: Best in ear headphones out there
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a Christmas gift new and my brothers puppy ate them, case and all. I got these used ones to replace them and they actually sound slightly better (I guess here was something wrong with the originals) but couldn’t give these headphones a higher rating. Best headphones I’ve ever had and I’ve had. After hearing the Bowers and Wilkins stereo in the new Volvos I had to get myself a pair...and I wasn’t disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The sound was great but too uncomfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones sounded great but the loop design for the inner ear was so uncomfortable I returned the product for a refund. Tried all the supplied ear pieces because I wanted the to work for me but they simply didn't fit my ear comfortably, after a few minutes they caused a sharp pain where the loop contacts the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Bose in-ear headphones and a set of noise cancelling headphones believing that these were "good." They sound ok but fall apart after a year of heavy use. So decided to get the Klipsch S4i which sounded better than the Bose and were less expensive. Yet, I still wanted something better. Based on reviews went with the B&W C5 and haven't regretted my purchase. I'm a little concerned about durability but they are going strong after 4 months. Time will tell Now, I'm looking forward to getting some P7 for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Del Aguila III

customer_reviews.title: Last pair of ears you will need.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned custom molds. These are 100% better. Bass response is incredible. The whole spectrum is so smooth. Love them. If you are a musician or audio engineer, these will be the last ears you own. Sound significantly better than all the shure in ears that I have used. 700 to the 425, There is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Silverimage

customer_reviews.title: They sound good when you get the fit correct
customer_reviews.text: These things are just okay honestly, I purchased these because I've had the P5 headphones and i'm not too impressed with them. They sound good when you get the fit correct, but sometimes that takes a lot of fiddling. Aside from that, my other issue is how fragile they are. They're flimsy compared to a lot of other IEMS I keep in rotation now (Shure SE215, Sony MDR-XB90EX) and considering the fact those are both cheaper and better made... it's a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeNiceThings

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, cheap construction. Lasted 3 months w daily use before wire frayed and sound became tinny and hollow
customer_reviews.author: Cakey

customer_reviews.title: good sound, terrible comfort
customer_reviews.text: I wen't from a pair of Bose In-Ear Headphones to these and it was pretty disappointing. The sound of these is quality, but not for what I paid for them. These were also incredibly uncomfortable for me. The secure loop might work for some but I couldn't keep them in for more than 10 minutes before my ears hurt. I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: 444music444

customer_reviews.title: Grab it if you can afford it. period. the end.
customer_reviews.text: When I first listened to these earphones, it was like the giant wave from interstellar sweeping my friggin' face away. Other earphones in contrast to this are as impressive as stumpy o leg mc no legs' personal best in a marathon. Pecise and accurate production of music, especially the mids and highs. Tight bass that sounds natural as compared to other earphones I have used. Ear fitting takes a little (2hrs) to get used to but it fits like a glove. Probably the best blind buy ever. Fantastic build and great sound, as expected of something with this price tag. A must have for anyone who can shell out almost 200 bucks for a quality pair of earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and fitment, not so great durability.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for 2 years now, with that being said, the sound quality and fitment are excelent, but after using it almost every day for 2+ years, it started to glitch (stopping songs, activating siri). I loved them, but this defect for me on a 160 dolar earphone is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: olavo

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in ear. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is ok but what a poor design. They are supposed to loop inside your ear but they don't stay in. Even when they do stay in as soon as you have a little moisture in your ears they slip out as the loop is shiny plastic material. Cannot be bothered returning them but they are really badly designed for a supposed premium company. #annoyed
customer_reviews.author: Mr Rafiki

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Hype
customer_reviews.text: They take some getting used to but I loves this things. Great sound quality, very sleek and cool. I don't work out in them but they are great as walking around town earbuds! Possibly the best sound quality I have ever owned
customer_reviews.author: Showboat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Third pair! I love these things, I recently lost a pair and I like to keep one pair at work and one at the house so it was time for me to re-up. Best in ear speaker out there. Worth the price if you don't misplace them like I did. DOH! And they really do a good job of blocking noise. I actually had these in shooting one time and they still did a pretty good job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I had the S1 and just bought the S2 after my S1 broke down. The quality of sound for all kinds of music is awesome and fits snuggly in the ear. My only complaint is the quality. I travel for work quit a bit and I feel like after a year or so the cable loosens and one of the ear pieces stop working so keep your receipt because the warranty will come in handy. Also because of the loop, the cables get tangled bad. If you are going to join an online call, keep 5 mins extra because you will need that time to entangle the cables! I wish they would use better quality cabling.
customer_reviews.author: tmny4eva

customer_reviews.title: Tricky at first but worth the money unless you love lots of bass.
customer_reviews.text: So takes just a bit to get used too. Once you get it your going to be happy with the results. The occular of the ear holds them in nicely but it does take just a bit of work at first. Sound is wonderful. Would like to have a bit more bass, so I gave 4 stars not 5! Mid range is awesome and treble is pretty good as well. Bass is just a bit too weak for my taste. Well worth the money at about half this price!
customer_reviews.author: MattTop Contributor: Harmonicas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great C5 Series 2 earphones! I love the sense of ambience these earphones provide. Ultra-low, well-balanced bass is the best I've heard with any sound reproduction device. Highs are clear and never shrill. Best of all, the Series 2 is less expensive than the original C5 earphones.
customer_reviews.author: RonC

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: In-ear fitment is a bit different from what I'd grown accustomed to using cheap ear buds. I primarily use these for listening to music on a Cowon Z2, death metal to classical. Since owning these I've found that I have no need for any EQ adjustments at all, they have very good response across the spectrum. They stay in place well enough to use routinely while working in the garage or on a car and do a decent job of isolating most background noises.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Zenoniani

customer_reviews.title: After some fussing, comfortable and clear
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the right ear plugs chosen, the seal is quite good enough to produce good bass. And the retention loop scheme works well and is very comfortable. These are a pleasure to have in your ear, contrasted with some earlier ear plugs I had that had to go into the ear canal. Limited listening time so far, but the sound is clear, analytical and broad. Does what I want in a compact and comfortable form.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Weil

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Just received these today. The sound quality is excellent, clear, crisp with a good amount of bass (very important to I) considering they are in-ear headphones. The sound quality rivals that of a $400 pair of bulky Sony headphones I have. Not bad for under $200. Tip: Ensure you try out all the different caps. You must use the right ones otherwise sound quality and bass levels drop.
customer_reviews.author: lilgambyt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I've had the B&W C5 S2 for about 3 months now. The sound from my Iphone is great (especially with the Audyssey music player app) . Much better and clearer than my old Klipsch S4i. The only bad parts are (1) that the 3 button remote lacks actual buttons & is hard to use accurately and (2) the loops still feel a bit strange, although they do hold the ear buds in place very well. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Suna

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones after you figure them out.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound but you must must must have the right buds in to make a perfect seal or the sound will suck. In my case I had to buy a third party ear bud made of foam to finally get these working right. These headphones are unforgiving so if your not listening to HIFI audio dont bother. Most mp3s will sound like crap.
customer_reviews.author: Bearfilm1

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great so he decided to keep them and rather deal ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Husband. He says his loves them but they do hurt his ears. Sound quality is great so he decided to keep them and rather deal with the pain. I am not convinced that it is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: College Student01

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely YES
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about the fit, at first, but once I tried them, I was in love. The weight feels so good. You just have to try them to get what I mean. They are weighted in such a way where they stay IN your ear, no matter what you're doing. Sleek design, definitely quality material. Worth every penny. Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Once you've taken a little time and determined exactly which ear buds fit best, these things sound amazing! The only problem that I have with them is that they pull out of my ear rather easily, causing me to have to push them back in, and readjust them often.
customer_reviews.author: BigTrees

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The best headphones I have ever owned. I have worn out two pairs over five years (all headphones eventually break if you wear them every day). The plugs cut out all external noise and the sound quality is extraordinary. Through these headphones I have heard tones and details in music that I've known well for 20 years. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cummings

customer_reviews.title: A little odd looking but the loop around the base of each transducer is adjustable and hold them in great. Sound quality is fant
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs of over the ear and in canal speakers before settling on these. A little odd looking but the loop around the base of each transducer is adjustable and hold them in great. Sound quality is fantastic and bassy, just like I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Futter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great! Lightweight and secure ear buds. High quality sound. free subscription to their Sound Society when you register them.
customer_reviews.author: hiseitz

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: These in-ear headphones are very good. Bowers & Wilkins sound is not likely going to disappoint many. Comfort is mediocre for me, but these headphones stay inside my ears extremely well when fitted correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: More natural sound than Bose
customer_reviews.text: Great and clear sound, the bass is deep and strong but could be too much for some people, comfortable when you find the correct position in your ear. I give 4 stars because the cable feels and looks fragile. I compared this earbuds with Bose QC20i, SoundTrue and FreeStyle, I have been always a Bose fan but this B&W have more natural sound.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing earphones. So good
customer_reviews.text: Amazing earphones. So good, that my brother stole them off me. My ears do get a little sore after hours of use with the loop. It also lets out a bit of sound. But in terms of build and sound quality, I couldn't ask for a better set.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L.

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent sounding in-ears
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent sounding in-ears, but you lose some elements of over-the-ear like noise cancelling and the overall fullness of sound. Still, these are way better than other in-ear or ear bud phones I've tried. I have some of the best bluetooth buds around, and they don't compare with these Bowers & Wilkins (which are not bluetooth).
customer_reviews.author: Randall S.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: As others have said before, these are very bass heavy which is fine if i'm listening to music but I also listen to a lot of audiobooks and the sound just doesn't work for me..... Disappointed in this product for the price
customer_reviews.author: SlightlyFussy

customer_reviews.title: These are the best sounding in ear earphones I have owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding in ear earphones I have owned. The over-the-ear wire configuration is a bit awkward and the price is a bit steep, but I am happy with the product
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Little

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but...
customer_reviews.text: I use these when jogging. Sound is excellent, just enough bass, etc., but they need to seal in your ear. Moving from a pair with hang around the ear loops, so took a while to get used to pushing these back in as jogging tends to loosen them.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound when they stay in your ear canal
customer_reviews.text: Great sound when they stay in your ear canal. Otherwise they keep falling out of my ear. Tried all the variable silicon ear pieces, all same result. Need to engineer something more "stay on attachment friendly".
customer_reviews.author: canuckhab

customer_reviews.title: Sound is perfect, but fit in ear is not
customer_reviews.text: Sound is perfect, but fit in ear is not. You need to be sure, that it will fit in your ears. I wear it without loops in ears.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: The thing about quality is you know it when you ...
customer_reviews.text: The thing about quality is you know it when you see, hear and experience it. Such a simple a effective in ear design it is crazy. Whether I'm running, biking, on the train these are my go to headphones.
customer_reviews.author: My 2 cents...

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! B&W once again doesn't disappoint. The sound quality if phenomenal. The earbuds take a little practice at positioning but will stay secure once placed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mulvany

customer_reviews.title: B&W's ear-sized masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: My fourth set. They keep getting better and better. Truly high fidelity absent absurdly heavy bass (unless it's in the original mix). My sole and not insignificant criticism is that if these wear like my previous sets, ultimately the "left" earphone will become intermittent and crap out as a function of weakness in the wire composition or the "joins." But until that day comes after about two years of near-daily use, I don't believe a better set of earbuds is out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair....I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, nice deep bass, just a tad bit uncomfortable at first...for me anyway. I recommend....
customer_reviews.author: Ron Pobuta

product_meta.title: Bowers & Wilkins C5 Series 2 In-Ear Headphones, Secure Fit, Black
product_meta.description:
Customer Package Type:Standard PackagingTrue Sound. Zero Distractions. 

Crystal Clear Audio 
C5 Series 2 contain a micro-porous filter that acts as a sonic diffuser, improving the clarity, depth and range of your music.
High Definition Drive Units 
C5 Series contain bespoke 9.2mm dynamic transducer and produce remarkable bass extension. 
Consistent Listening Experience 
Tungsten steel weights balance the speaker units towards the ear, so you'll get clean, consistent audio no matter how bumpy your ride. 
Ergonomic in-ear headphones. Powerful bass and a user adjustable design make C5 Series 2 one of best lightweight audio experiences around.

** If you have any volume issues with the product, please check to ensure your product connection is secure between device and headphones**Apple compatibility - The remote and mic are supported by the iPhone 3GS and later, iPod Touch 2nd generation & later, iPad all models. The remote is supported by iPod Classic all models, iPod Nano 4th generation & later, iPod Shuffle 3rd generation & later.

BOX CONTAINS
C5 Series 2 In-Ear Headphones 
Ear Tips (3 sizes) 
Literature pack 
Pouch
feature_bullets: REDESIGNED FOR PREMIUM AUDIO AND COMFORT - C5 Series 2 hifi earbuds feature redesigned drive units for enhanced sound quality and a new cable for better comfort and performance. C5's snug fit and stunningly realistic sound means you can forget the rest of the world and lose yourself in music. At the same time, these in-ear headphones let in just enough ambient noise to allow you to retain your sense of place.

CONTROLS iPHONE AUDIO - Made with an iPhone remote/microphone compatible cable, they can control your iPhone just like the stock earbuds. They will also work with all other smartphones, tablets and MP3 players (mobile devices other than compatible iOS models will not necessarily offer control functionality)
INNOVATIVE SECURE LOOP DESIGN - Created with a cushioned loop that curls around the ear’s inner rim to hold them in place, the C5 S2 ensures a precise yet comfortable fit, even on the go
RICH AND EXPANSIVE AUDIO - The Micro Porous Filter acts as a sonic diffuser, opening up the sound and making music feel remarkably rich and expansive, even in a small package

2 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY - Bowers & Wilkins' C5 S2 In-Ear Headphones come with a 2-year limited warranty only when purchased from an authorized dealer including Amazon.com (indicated by ships from and sold by Amazon.com)
